朹字的基本解释

朹
qiú
古书上说的一种树木，即山楂。

朹
guǐ
古同“簋”，古代一种盛食物的器皿。

朹字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qiú］
［《廣韻》巨鳩切，平尤，羣。］
(1)山楂，又名檕梅。
(2)杨梅。
[②]［guǐ］
［《廣韻》居洧切，上旨，見。］
通“簋1”。

朹字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　朹； 康熙笔画：6； 页码：页510第11
【說文】古簋字。註詳竹部十一畫。　又【唐韻】巨鳩切【集韻】【韻會】渠尤切，?音求。木名。【爾雅·釋木】朹檕梅。【註】朹樹狀似梅，子如指頭，色赤似小柰，可食。【本草補遺】朹子、山樝一物也。　又【方言】朹，仇也。謂怨仇也。【註】巨救切，音舊。

考證：〔【爾雅·釋木】朹檕梅。【註】朹樹狀似梅，子大如指。〕　謹照原文大如指改如指頭。
朹字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
朹字的起名意思

古书上说的一种树木，即山楂。

Shi
Basic explanation of words
Shi
qiú
A kind of tree mentioned in ancient books, namely hawthorn.
Shi
guǐ
In ancient times, the same "gui", a kind of vessel for holding food in ancient times.
Shi
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qiú］
["Guangyun" Giant Dove Cut, Ping You, Group. ]
(1) Hawthorn, also known as Piaomei.
(2) Yangmei.
[②]［guǐ］
["Guangyun" is very close, the decrement, see you. ]
Same as "gui 1".
Shi
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Ji] [Wood Character Department] 　朹; Kangxi Strokes: 6; Page Number: Page 510 No. 11
【Speaking text】Ancient Gui character. Note the eleven paintings of the bamboo department　[Tang Yun] Giant Dove Cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Qu Youqie,? Yinqiu. Wooden name. 【Erya·Shimu】Pupio plum. [Note] The tree is like a plum, the child is like a finger, and the color is like a small 柰, and it is edible. 【Materia Medica Supplement】Phuzi and Hawthorn are also a thing.　[Dialect] Shi, Qiu Ye. That is also grudges. [Note] Jujiu cut, the sound is old. Textual research: [[Erya·Shimu] Pupumei. [Note] The tree is shaped like a plum, and the son is as big as a finger. 〕　I would like to change as a finger as a finger as in the original text.
